bio: Shams Mulani is an Indian cricketer who plays for Mumbai in domestic cricket and Mumbai in the Indian Premier League. He made his Twenty20 debut for Mumbai in the 2017–18 Zonal T20 League on 11 January 2018. He made his List A debut for Mumbai in the 2017–18 Vijay Hazare Trophy on 5 February 2018. In October 2018, he was named to India A's squad for the 2018–19 Deodhar Trophy. In December 2018, he was named in India's team for the 2018 ACC Emerging Teams Asia Cup. In December 2019, in the opening round of the 2019–20 Ranji Trophy, he took his first five-wicket haul in first-class cricket. He took 46 wickets in seven games in the 2022-23 Ranji season and 16 scalps in 10 matches in the 2022-23 Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. Mulani has been a prolific cricketer for Mumbai in the domestic circuit and played an important role in the side’s triumph against Vidarbha in the 2023-24 Ranji Trophy Final. A willy all-rounder, Mulani also got picked up by the Mumbai franchise for the 2024 Indian Premier League.
